creator: thorsten@apache.org
text:
The notification inbox is only reachable via the admin area with a direct link.
Meaning that only admins can reach them directly, other groups has to enter the
link in the url.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
If you have new messages, you can use the link in the status bar. Maybe we could
show the link also if there are no new messages ("0 new messages").

creator: thorsten@apache.org
text:
Yeah or just a plain link to the inbox (if no message).

However I have a usecase where the inbox is not reachable.

Image you have a user "test" and the group "forbidden". I allowed this user to
see the index page:
group  	  forbidden  	  visit  	  grant

Now I login and see the page as test and see that I have a new message, but
clicking on it I get:
"The user 'test' is not authorized to access the page
'/default/authoring/index.html'."

creator: thorsten@apache.org
text: The last comment can be overcome to allow the role visit to see the inbox.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
I guess the usecase-policies.xml don't allow the user to view the inbox. Maybe
you have to add a specific role for this kind of users.
